lesson_title: Private Pilot Lesson #1 – Takeoffs, Landings, Slow Flight & Stalls
lesson_objective: By the end of this lesson, you’ll begin to understand how slow flight ties directly into the landing phase. We’ll break down the aerodynamic concepts and start developing muscle memory for stable, controlled landings and coordinated flight near stall speed.

schedule_overview.pre_brief: 30 min – Walk through slow flight and stall procedures
schedule_overview.flight_block: 2 hrs – Maneuver training + pattern work at an untowered airport
schedule_overview.post_brief: Up to 1 hr – Debrief + Intro to PAVE (time permitting)

core_topics: Traffic Pattern Procedures at Untowered Airports
performance_standards: We’re not expecting perfection this early — the goal is to understand the relationship between slow flight and the landing phase. If by the end of the flight you can safely fly slow flight in both configurations, recognize stalls, and start to correlate those skills with real-world landings, we’re in great shape.

resources.title: AFH Chapter 5 – Slow Flight, Stalls, and Spins
resources.description: FAA guidance on maneuvering during slow flight and recognizing/stalling conditions.

resources.title: AFH Chapter 8 – Traffic Patterns
resources.description: Covers standard pattern entries and radio procedures at untowered airports.

resources.title: Slow Flight Explained
resources.description: Step-by-step explanation of slow flight entry, control, and recovery.

resources.title: Stall Recognition and Recovery
resources.description: Demonstrates how to identify stall conditions and perform proper recovery techniques.

resources.title: Traffic Pattern Procedures – Untowered Airports
resources.description: Overview of VFR pattern work, radio calls, and pattern safety tips.

key_skills_to_focus_on: Understanding how pitch and power interact at low speeds
Recognizing and recovering from stall indications
Managing descent rate and timing the flare during landings
common_errors_to_avoid: Letting the nose drop during stall recovery
Ballooning or flaring too high during landing
Fixating on one instrument or point during maneuvering
your_role_in_the_cockpit: You’ll be flying each maneuver after I demo them. I’ll coach you through the slow flight and stall entries, and we’ll build your comfort in the pattern as we go. You’ll also start handling radio calls at the untowered airport.
final_thoughts: This lesson is a major building block for everything that follows in your training. Takeoffs and landings are where everything comes together, and slow flight is the foundation. If we have time after the flight, we’ll kick off our deeper dive into aeronautical decision-making by starting the PAVE checklist, focusing on “P – Pilot” (which includes the IMSAFE checklist).
